description.narrative: The Project is expected to have the following development impacts: i. Economic and Private Sector Development: Investment in high-growth TMT companies and establishing telecom and IT infrastructure in high-need areas, including in Sub-Saharan Africa and Asia will contribute to economic growth and deepening of private markets. ii. Knowledge transfer and demonstration effect: The Fund employs, hands-on/value-added strategy with its portfolio companies, thereby transferring management and sector knowledge to emerging market firms, leading to greater competitiveness and sustainability. iii. Creation of New Jobs: Support the creation of new jobs as investee companies expand. iv. Private Equity Development: Support and further develop emerging private equity industry in the target regions.

The proposed project is an investment of up to US$20 million in equity, not to exceed 20% of total fund commitments, in Delta Partners Emerging Markets TMT Growth Fund II, L.P. (the Fund), a private equity fund sponsored by Delta Partners Group (Delta). Delta is seeking to raise US$350 million of aggregate commitments for the Fund, with initial closing targeted at US$100 million and a hard cap at US$500 million. The Fund will invest in Telecoms, Media, and related Technology (TMT) companies in Africa, Central & Eastern Europe, the Middle East, and South East Asia, and will provide expansion and growth capital through equity and equity-related investments to a diversified portfolio of private TMT businesses such as broadband & data access, corporate ICT & data centers, localized new media, and network optimization technologies. The Fund may also invest in debt securities that have equity-like returns or an equity component, or are related to its equity investments.

participating-org.narrative: DELTA PARTNERS EMERGING MARKETS TMT GROWTH FUND II LP

mailing-address.narrative: Geoffrey D. Fink Managing Partner & Head of Investments Delta PartnersPO Box 502428, Media One Tower, 29th floor, Dubai Internet City, United Arab Emirates Telephone: +971 4 369 2999 Fax : +971 4 368 8408 Email: mailto:gdf@deltapartnersgroup.com

name.narrative: The Fund will be structured as an exempted limited partnership in the Cayman Islands. The Fund and its general partner (the General Partner or GP) are in the process of being established. Delta Partners Capital Limited will act as the manager of the Fund (the Manager) and is being established as a company under the laws of the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC).
